definition: lit. fox's tail (idiom); visible sign of evil intentions/to reveal one's evil nature/evidence that reveals the villain
fox
raccoon dog/fox-like animal
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: A fox cannot hide its tail.
A fox cannot hide its tail.; Evils cannot be covered up.
Another similar expression is "showing the fox's tail", meaning let the cat out of bag, or give the game away.
sentences.chinese: 這就跟說“露出了狐狸尾巴”一樣，表示露出了破綻。

definition: sth one wishes to conceal/the cat (as in "let the cat out of the bag")
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
original identity fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
true identity/true colors
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
old fox/fig. cunning person
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
sinister plot/dirty trick/cheap trick
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to confess without being pressed/to make a confession without duress
to expose/to uncover
affectation
pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
fox/fig. sly and treacherous person
